verses.roman:
evaṁ tau loka-siddhābhiḥ
krīḍābhiś ceratur vane
nady-adri-droṇi-kuñjeṣu
kānaneṣu saraḥsu ca

synonyms: evam—in this way; tau—the two of Them, Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma; loka-siddhābhiḥ—which are well known in human society; krīḍābhiḥ—with games; ceratuḥ—They wandered; vane—in the forest; nadī—among the rivers; adri—mountains; droṇi—valleys; kuñjeṣu—and groves; kānaneṣu—in the smaller forests; saraḥsu—along the lakes; ca—and.
translation: In this way Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma played all sorts of well-known games as They wandered among the rivers, hills, valleys, bushes, trees and lakes of Vṛndāvana.
